document_data.name: Leviathan
document_data.mainbody: A '''leviathan''' was an elder [[elemental]] of [[water]], a very rare variety of elementals that possessed immense proportions and apocalyptic power.
document_data.Description: Though these creatures had fluid forms on account of being composed entirely of water, leviathans generally took on the form of a [[serpent]]ine shape.
document_data.Behavior: Leviathans exhibited a rudimentary, bestial intelligence.
document_data.History: Sometime prior to [[1401 DR]], members of the [[Cult of the Crushing Wave]] brought three leviathans onto Toril as part of some plot. On [[Tarsakh 17]], 1401 DR,{{Cite adventurers league/The Harrowing of Hell|18}} these leviathans attacked the [[galleon]] of the [[storm giant]]s [[Hekaton]] and [[Uthor]] in the [[Trackless Sea]] as they were sailing back home to [[Maelstrom]] after a diplomatic meeting. During the battle with the leviathans, Hekaton channeled the power of the ''[[Wyrmskull Throne]]'' within his vessel and summoned a spectral [[blue dragon]] to turn the gargantuan elementals away.{{Cite adventurers league/The Harrowing of Hell|18-20}} This day would be remembered and talked of by [[giant]] historians in the many years that followed.

Ecology.Homelands: These creatures were natively found in the [[Elemental Plane of Water]].
Ecology.Summoning:
Unlike most elementals, for whom a wide variety of means of [[summoning]] them from their native [[plane]] were known, very few knew how to conjure a leviathan. The secret methods by which to do so were locked away within profane [[book|texts]] and inscriptions within ancient temples dedicated to the [[Elder Elemental Eye]].

These methods demanded exceptional skills in [[spellcaster|spellcasting]] to function, though even if a spellcaster were able to accomplish such a feat they were more than likely be killed by the conjured leviathan. Due to this risk and the threat that even one leviathan posed, the only spellcasters known to seek them out were the most unhinged and nihilistic cultists of the Elder Elemental Eye, in hopes that they may exhilirate the end of the world.
some cataclysmic end.
